weather_report:
Williams wakes to a soft, rain-polished morning. Light showers in the early hours have left the streets darkened and reflective, the air cool and a little fragrant, horizons smudged by a low, even ceiling of cloud. Sunlight will be scarce, arriving, if at all, in brief, shy openings; the UV index stays low while the overcast holds, perhaps nudging to modest if the deck thins for a spell midday. Expect the day to drift between misting sprinkles and long, gray pauses, more quiet than fierce, with no great theatrics beyond the hush of water on leaves.

It looks more contemplative than unpleasant. Dress in easy layers with a light waterproof shell and shoes that don’t mind puddles; tuck a compact umbrella in a bag and sunglasses only if you’re an optimist. This is a good morning for errands unrushed, a slow walk when the rain eases, a library stop, or a window seat at a café where the world outside blurs into silver. If you’re staying home, put on some music and sort a drawer, simmer something simple, or give the car’s wipers a once-over before the next shower.
